name: ArangoDB
description: ArangoDB is a multi-model database that supports document, key-value, and graph data models within a single query language (AQL). It is designed for flexibility and scalability, offering features like joins, transactions, and sharding. ArangoDB is used in real-time recommendation engines, graph analytics, and microservices backends.

name: Amazon Aurora
description: Amazon Aurora is a fully managed relational database from AWS, compatible with MySQL and PostgreSQL. It offers high performance and availability by replicating data across multiple Availability Zones. Aurora scales automatically and supports serverless configurations for variable workloads.

name: Google BigQuery
description: BigQuery is Google Cloud’s fully managed serverless data warehouse. It supports fast SQL queries using Google’s Dremel engine and is optimized for big data analytics. BigQuery is widely used for processing large datasets, running machine learning models, and performing business intelligence workloads.

name: Apache Cassandra
description: Apache Cassandra is a highly scalable NoSQL database optimized for high availability and write-intensive workloads. Originally developed at Facebook, Cassandra uses a masterless architecture and supports multi-datacenter replication. It's well-suited for large-scale applications like social media, IoT, and financial systems where uptime and partition tolerance are crucial.

name: ClickHouse
description: ClickHouse is an open-source column-oriented database management system for real-time analytics. It delivers lightning-fast query performance on large datasets and is optimized for OLAP workloads. Used by companies like Yandex and Cloudflare.

name: CockroachDB
description: CockroachDB is a distributed SQL database built for cloud-native applications. Inspired by Google Spanner, it offers horizontal scalability, strong consistency, and automatic failover. CockroachDB is ideal for transactional workloads that require high availability and global distribution, and it provides PostgreSQL compatibility for seamless migration.

name: CouchDB
description: CouchDB is a NoSQL document database using JSON and RESTful APIs. It supports multi-master replication, offline sync, and high fault tolerance. CouchDB is ideal for distributed and mobile-first applications requiring robust syncing.

name: Dolt
description: Dolt is a SQL database with Git-style version control. It allows users to clone, branch, merge, and diff data like code. This makes it ideal for collaborative data workflows, auditing, and data governance use cases where change tracking is essential.

name: Amazon DynamoDB
description: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service offered by AWS, designed for high availability, scalability, and performance. It supports key-value and document data models, automatic sharding, global replication, and built-in security. DynamoDB is used in serverless architectures, gaming, mobile backends, and IoT systems due to its low-latency access and seamless integration with AWS services.

name: etcd
description: etcd is a distributed key-value store that provides configuration management and service discovery. It is a core component of Kubernetes and ensures high availability through the Raft consensus algorithm.

name: Firebase Realtime Database
description: Firebase Realtime Database is a cloud-hosted NoSQL database that lets you store and sync data between your users in real-time. Designed for mobile and web apps, it uses JSON as the data format and offers real-time syncing capabilities. It integrates tightly with other Firebase services, enabling serverless backend infrastructure.

name: Firebolt
description: Firebolt is a modern cloud data warehouse built for speed, combining SQL with performance similar to NoSQL systems. It offers vectorized query execution and columnar storage optimized for large-scale analytics. Ideal for dashboards, customer-facing analytics, and interactive exploration.

name: Greenplum
description: Greenplum Database is a massively parallel processing (MPP) SQL database built on PostgreSQL. It's designed for analytics and large-scale data warehousing with horizontal scaling. Greenplum supports complex queries, machine learning, and in-database analytics.

name: InfluxDB
description: InfluxDB is an open-source time-series database designed for high-performance monitoring, metrics, and events. It’s commonly used for DevOps monitoring, IoT analytics, and real-time dashboards. InfluxDB supports a SQL-like query language (Flux) and integrates with tools like Grafana and Telegraf.

name: LevelDB
description: LevelDB is Google’s high-performance key-value storage library used as a backend in many systems. It provides ordered key iteration and is often found in low-level storage engines or blockchain applications.

name: MongoDB
description: MongoDB is a leading NoSQL document database known for its flexibility, scalability, and developer-friendly features. It stores data in JSON-like BSON format and is ideal for applications with dynamic or unstructured data. MongoDB supports indexing, sharding, replication, and rich aggregation pipelines.

name: MySQL
description: MySQL is a widely used open-source relational database management system developed by Oracle. Known for its performance, scalability, and reliability, MySQL is the backbone of many web applications and CMS platforms like WordPress and Drupal. It offers support for replication, partitioning, clustering, and multiple storage engines including InnoDB for ACID-compliant transactions.

name: Neo4j
description: Neo4j is the most popular graph database designed to handle highly connected data. It uses the Cypher query language and stores data in nodes, relationships, and properties. Neo4j is ideal for social networks, fraud detection, recommendation engines, and knowledge graphs.

name: PostgreSQL
description: PostgreSQL is a powerful, open-source object-relational database system known for its robustness, extensibility, and compliance with SQL standards. It supports advanced features like full-text search, JSONB, spatial data via PostGIS, and custom extensions. PostgreSQL is widely adopted for complex applications requiring strong consistency, ACID compliance, and powerful indexing capabilities.

name: PouchDB
description: PouchDB is an open-source JavaScript database for offline-first apps. It stores data in JSON and syncs with CouchDB-compatible servers. Commonly used in browser-based and mobile applications needing local storage with cloud synchronization.

name: QuestDB
description: QuestDB is a high-performance open-source time-series database optimized for real-time analytics and financial data. It features SQL support, low-latency ingestion, and vectorized execution. It is ideal for use cases like monitoring systems and trading platforms.

name: Realm
description: Realm is a mobile-first object database developed by MongoDB. It enables data persistence using native objects and supports offline-first apps. It’s ideal for iOS and Android development, offering real-time sync and tight integration with MongoDB Atlas.

name: Redis
description: Redis is an in-memory data structure store often used as a cache, message broker, or real-time database. It supports strings, hashes, lists, sets, sorted sets, bitmaps, and streams. Redis delivers ultra-fast performance and includes features like persistence, Lua scripting, replication, and high availability with Redis Sentinel and Redis Cluster.

name: rqlite
description: rqlite is a distributed relational database built on SQLite with Raft for consensus. It ensures strong consistency and high availability, making it great for edge, embedded, and microservice-based applications that need reliability.

name: Snowflake
description: Snowflake is a fully managed cloud-based data warehouse known for separating compute and storage. It supports structured and semi-structured data and enables near-infinite scaling. Snowflake is widely used for analytics, data sharing, and multi-cloud architecture.

name: SQLite
description: SQLite is a lightweight, embedded relational database engine that requires no server or configuration. It stores the entire database in a single file and is widely used in mobile applications, desktop software, and IoT devices. Despite its compact size, SQLite is fully transactional and supports most of the SQL standard, including joins, triggers, and views.

name: TiDB
description: TiDB is a distributed SQL database that offers horizontal scalability and MySQL compatibility. Built by PingCAP, it provides strong consistency, automatic sharding, and HTAP capabilities (hybrid transactional and analytical processing). It's used for real-time analytics and transactional workloads.

name: TimescaleDB
description: TimescaleDB is a time-series database built on PostgreSQL. It offers full SQL support with time-series features like hypertables and continuous aggregates. It’s used in application monitoring, sensor tracking, and analytics dashboards for time-stamped data.

name: Vitess
description: Vitess is a database clustering system for horizontal scaling of MySQL. It manages large-scale deployments and supports sharding, replication, and failover. Vitess powers some of the world's largest platforms like YouTube, ensuring reliability and performance.

name: YugaByteDB
description: YugaByteDB is a distributed SQL database for cloud-native applications. It supports PostgreSQL APIs and enables global distribution with high resilience and consistency. It's ideal for transactional apps needing fault tolerance and horizontal scalability.

name: DuckDB
description: DuckDB is an in-process SQL OLAP database management system designed for analytical workloads. It provides fast performance through vectorized execution and columnar storage, while maintaining ease of use with a familiar SQL interface. DuckDB is ideal for embedded analytics, data science, and lightweight data warehousing on local machines or in notebooks. It supports complex queries, joins, and aggregations efficiently without requiring external infrastructure.

name: SurrealDB
description: SurrealDB is a multi-model database that merges document, graph, and relational models in one unified engine. It includes built-in user authentication, role-based access, real-time queries, and supports both SQL-like and NoSQL operations. SurrealDB is schema-optional and supports deeply nested structures, making it well-suited for modern web apps, APIs, and real-time platforms.

name: Dolt
description: Dolt is a version-controlled SQL database that combines Git-like functionality with relational database features. Users can clone, branch, diff, merge, and push data as if working with code. It enables collaborative data workflows and auditable changes, making it perfect for use cases involving regulatory compliance, data science, and decentralized contributions.

name: Chroma
description: Chroma is an open-source embedding database designed for AI-native applications. It supports storing and querying vector embeddings using similarity search. Chroma includes features like metadata filtering, automatic versioning, and real-time updates, making it ideal for building semantic search, recommendation engines, and RAG pipelines.

name: TerminusDB
description: TerminusDB is a document-oriented graph database optimized for collaborative environments and complex data structures. It features immutable data, Git-style versioning, time travel, and schema-first design. TerminusDB is ideal for data-intensive apps, linked data management, and knowledge graphs.

name: Tantivy
description: Tantivy is a full-text search engine library written in Rust. Though not a traditional database, it serves as a highly efficient search index that can be embedded in database systems or standalone apps. It supports inverted indexing, fuzzy search, ranking models, and multilingual tokenizers.

name: Pebble
description: Pebble is a LevelDB/RocksDB-compatible key-value store built in Go by CockroachDB. It is optimized for performance and correctness in modern storage workloads. Pebble is used as the underlying storage engine in distributed databases and supports WAL, compaction, snapshots, and SSTable formats.

name: Tigris
description: Tigris is a transactional document database with embedded real-time indexing, streaming, and schema enforcement. It supports JSON document storage and ACID compliance out-of-the-box. Tigris is tailored for modern backend applications, offering a developer-first experience with SDKs and gRPC APIs.

name: Orb
description: Orb is a decentralized graph database optimized for real-time collaboration. It merges CRDT-based syncing with flexible schemas and graph structures, enabling offline-first apps with automatic conflict resolution and multi-user concurrency.

name: ManifoldDB
description: ManifoldDB is a research-oriented database engine built for high-performance analytical queries on modern hardware. It features vectorized execution, JIT compilation, and SIMD support. Its goal is to bridge the performance of native C++ engines with the flexibility of high-level language interfaces.

name: Weaviate
description: Weaviate is a cloud-native, real-time vector database built for semantic search and generative AI applications. It enables efficient storage and retrieval of high-dimensional vectors with support for hybrid search (text + vector), multi-tenancy, modular transformers, and metadata filtering. Weaviate integrates with popular embedding models and includes REST and GraphQL APIs.

name: XTDB
description: XTDB is a bitemporal database for immutable data management. It supports SQL, Datalog, and document storage backed by an append-only log. XTDB allows point-in-time queries with temporal joins, making it ideal for auditing, historical tracking, and complex time-based queries in enterprise environments.

name: Immudb
description: Immudb is a tamper-proof key-value database with built-in cryptographic verification. It stores cryptographic hashes of each transaction to provide verifiable audit logs. Immudb is well-suited for applications that require zero-trust security, such as financial records, logs, and configuration tracking.

name: Dqlite
description: Dqlite (distributed SQLite) is a lightweight, high-availability database that uses SQLite and Raft consensus for replication. It offers an embedded solution for distributed apps requiring strong consistency, minimal overhead, and simplicity of SQL without the complexity of full-fledged distributed databases.

name: MindsDB
description: MindsDB is a machine learning-powered database layer that allows training and deploying ML models directly from SQL. It connects to popular databases and enables predictive queries using AI models like OpenAI, Hugging Face, and custom ML pipelines. MindsDB simplifies AI integration for developers without leaving their database environment.

name: TileDB
description: TileDB is a universal database for managing multidimensional arrays, images, genomic data, and other complex data types. It supports dense and sparse arrays with built-in support for time series, geospatial, and biomedical formats. TileDB’s cloud-native architecture and multiple APIs (Python, R, C++, REST) make it ideal for scientific computing.

name: bbolt
description: bbolt is an embedded, ACID-compliant key-value store written in Go. It is a fork of BoltDB with improved performance and reliability. bbolt is used in many Go-based projects as a simple, high-performance database with no external dependencies.

name: EventQL
description: EventQL is a distributed event database designed for storing large volumes of immutable event data. It supports SQL-like queries over time-series datasets with fast aggregations, making it suitable for real-time analytics, monitoring, and IoT pipelines.

name: BagelDB
description: BagelDB is a developer-focused, GraphQL-based headless backend that supports custom schemas, real-time updates, file storage, and role-based access. It simplifies backend logic for mobile and web apps by abstracting CRUD and user authentication.

name: AscendDB
description: AscendDB is a real-time data mesh layer that provides change data capture (CDC), streaming transformations, and unified control over multiple data sources. It allows you to build pipelines directly on top of cloud warehouses and databases without complex orchestration.

name: Turso
description: Turso is an edge-hosted distributed database based on libSQL, a fork of SQLite. It provides low-latency, geographically distributed read replicas and sync support for mobile and edge devices. Turso is ideal for serverless applications, real-time collaboration, and offline-first apps needing strong consistency and embedded SQL.

name: QuestDB
description: QuestDB is a high-performance time-series database designed for fast ingestion and real-time analytics using SQL. It leverages a column-oriented structure, SIMD acceleration, and low-latency ingestion for telemetry, finance, and observability workloads. QuestDB is optimized for horizontal scaling and ultra-fast joins on time-series data.

name: Typesense
description: Typesense is an open-source, typo-tolerant search engine optimized for developer-friendly experiences. While primarily a search engine, it functions as a lightweight read-optimized document store with support for real-time indexing, filters, geolocation, and federated search. Typesense is ideal for fast search across large collections of records.

name: Immudb Lite
description: Immudb Lite is a lightweight variant of the full immudb server tailored for embedded systems and microservices. It retains tamper-evident features and verifiable storage but with a reduced footprint, perfect for logs, configuration storage, and distributed ledger applications at the edge.

name: Materialize
description: Materialize is a real-time streaming database that transforms streaming data into materialized views using standard SQL. It supports PostgreSQL-compatible syntax and connects to Kafka, Debezium, S3, and more. Materialize excels at reducing latency for dashboards and live analytics pipelines.

name: ArcadeDB
description: ArcadeDB is a multi-model database that combines the flexibility of document, graph, object, and key/value models in a single engine. It features a fast query engine, SQL-like syntax, REST API, and full ACID compliance. Suitable for complex applications like fraud detection and social networks.

name: rqlite
description: rqlite is a distributed SQLite database that uses the Raft consensus protocol to maintain consistency across nodes. It is ideal for lightweight, fault-tolerant applications that need SQL capabilities and high availability without the complexity of full-scale distributed databases.

name: Polyseam
description: Polyseam is a developer-first polyglot persistence platform that integrates SQL, NoSQL, and file-based models into a single programmable runtime. It enables building data-driven apps with minimal boilerplate, using unified queries across heterogeneous sources.

name: Firestorm
description: Firestorm is a distributed JSON document database built on Firecracker microVMs. It offers ultra-low latency, containerized security, and per-request isolation. Its architecture is suited for privacy-first SaaS apps, secure data platforms, and multi-tenant APIs.

name: CrateDB
description: CrateDB is a distributed SQL database optimized for time-series and machine data. It supports PostgreSQL wire protocol, full-text search, geospatial queries, and horizontal scaling. CrateDB blends the performance of NoSQL with the flexibility of SQL for IoT, logs, and monitoring platforms.

name: OpenPanel DB
description: OpenPanel DB is a scalable analytics-focused time-series database designed for user behavior tracking and funnel analysis. It offers ingestion APIs, automatic data compaction, query optimization, and support for millions of events per second. Suited for building custom dashboards and behavioral analytics apps.

name: GlueSQL
description: GlueSQL is an embedded SQL database engine written in Rust that can be used to add SQL query capabilities to any storage backend (S3, files, memory, etc.). It supports a modular storage layer, making it highly pluggable for IoT and serverless contexts.

name: HyperDB
description: HyperDB is a distributed append-only database built for replication across peers. It features CRDT-based conflict resolution, secure append logs, and Merkle tree verification. It’s useful in P2P apps, offline-first experiences, and decentralized systems.

name: BaGet DB
description: BaGet is a lightweight database-backed NuGet server and package repository manager. While focused on .NET packages, it stores metadata and binary blobs using SQLite or PostgreSQL. It’s suitable for internal development teams hosting private packages.

name: Lightstream
description: Lightstream is a lightweight change data capture (CDC) tool for SQLite databases. It continuously replicates changes to a backup file or remote database using write-ahead log monitoring. Lightstream is ideal for embedding replication into small-scale apps.

name: Noms
description: Noms is a decentralized, versioned, append-only database inspired by Git. It enables powerful data synchronization, schema evolution, and collaborative use cases. Noms is designed for storing structured data that changes over time and benefits from immutability.

name: Baserow DB
description: Baserow DB is an open-source no-code database platform that resembles Airtable. It allows teams to build custom applications using spreadsheet-like interfaces backed by PostgreSQL. Baserow offers REST and plugin APIs, row-level permissions, and collaborative editing.

name: NorthwindLite
description: NorthwindLite is a minimalist, educational database framework that recreates the famous Northwind schema using SQLite and modern web tools. Ideal for teaching SQL and prototyping, it includes sample data, joins, and CRUD examples in a compact package.

name: Kamu
description: Kamu is a decentralized, versioned data infrastructure that supports verifiable open data pipelines. It combines blockchain-based proofs with data lineage and offers queryable datasets via WASM, CSV, or SQL interfaces. Useful for civic data, research, and trust-based data publication.

name: PgCat
description: PgCat is a high-performance connection pooler for PostgreSQL designed for cloud-native environments. It supports sharding, failover, authentication, and query routing, making it ideal for scalable, multi-tenant applications requiring PostgreSQL backends.

name: Valkey
description: Valkey is a high-performance in-memory key-value data store forked from Redis, developed after Redis became source-available. It supports pub/sub, data persistence, replication, and modules for advanced data structures. Valkey ensures open governance, community-led development, and full compatibility with Redis clients.

name: Quine
description: Quine is a streaming graph database that combines real-time event processing with persistent graph queries. It enables building complex knowledge graphs from event streams, ideal for fraud detection, security analytics, and network analysis. Built for low-latency, high-throughput use cases.

name: SpaceUp
description: SpaceUp is an open-source, real-time backend engine that includes a built-in database abstraction layer. It supports MongoDB, PostgreSQL, and SQL Server, allowing developers to write real-time apps without managing database queries manually. Features include GraphQL APIs, authorization rules, and live queries.

name: TerminusX
description: TerminusX is the cloud-native version of TerminusDB offering team-based data collaboration, version control, and data workflows. It enables building data products with branching, diffing, and merging. TerminusX is suitable for projects involving data pipelines, collaborative modeling, and linked data.

name: CellDB
description: CellDB is a high-performance in-memory spreadsheet-like database that enables ultra-low latency analytics over tabular data. It provides a reactive query engine, cell formulas, and Excel-style behavior with full ACID compliance, optimized for embedded analytics and BI tools.

name: Persy
description: Persy is a single-file transactional database engine written in Rust. It offers full ACID transactions, concurrent access, and append-only data storage. Ideal for local-first and embedded systems that require durability and consistency without a networked database.

name: SurrealQLite
description: SurrealQLite is a mini version of SurrealDB that targets SQLite-style embedded usage with SurrealDB's multi-model querying capabilities. It supports graph traversal, document storage, and role-based access in a tiny, embeddable form factor.

name: SleeperDB
description: SleeperDB is a scalable, cloud-native, time-series database designed for object storage backends. Built using Apache Parquet, it supports Spark, Presto, and Trino integration. Best suited for large-scale, infrequently queried data like logs and compliance records.

name: HeliumDB
description: HeliumDB is a lightweight vector-aware document store designed for fast embedding queries and real-time personalization. It features built-in vector indexing, JSON storage, and fuzzy match capabilities for search and recommendation use cases.

name: OrbitalDB
description: OrbitalDB is a decentralized, orbit-based database built on IPFS. It offers offline-first data sync, append-only logs, and multi-device consistency through Merkle DAGs. Ideal for peer-to-peer and distributed identity systems.

name: Resin
description: Resin is an embedded reactive database engine that synchronizes state between a frontend application and local storage. Built using Rust and WebAssembly, Resin is ideal for offline-first web applications, enabling reactive views and structured data persistence without backend APIs.

name: FerretDB
description: FerretDB is an open-source proxy that turns PostgreSQL into a MongoDB-compatible database. It allows users to run MongoDB-style applications and queries on top of relational databases, enabling easier migration and greater portability.

name: WebSQLX
description: WebSQLX is a modern browser-optimized database engine that mimics WebSQL and IndexedDB behaviors using WASM and SQLite. It allows developers to store relational data persistently in the browser with full SQL support, ideal for PWA and offline apps.

name: MeiliSync
description: MeiliSync is a lightweight synchronization service that mirrors PostgreSQL or MySQL databases to Meilisearch in real-time. It allows applications to benefit from fast full-text search capabilities while keeping the search index automatically updated.

name: Metarank DB
description: Metarank is a lightweight personalization database and re-ranking engine for search, recommendation, and feed optimization. It collects real-time user interaction data and uses feature engineering to adapt rankings dynamically.

name: Delta-rs
description: Delta-rs is a Rust-native library for reading and writing Delta Lake tables. It enables ACID transactions and time travel capabilities for large-scale data lakes using object storage like S3, GCS, and Azure Blob. It integrates with Arrow and Polars for analytics.

name: RRWeb DB
description: RRWeb DB is a session-recording oriented document store optimized for capturing and querying user interaction data. It supports timeline replays, event filtering, and analytics on structured front-end behavior, enabling replay analytics in modern applications.

name: ParquetDB
description: ParquetDB is a high-efficiency columnar database built on Apache Arrow and Apache Parquet. It provides fast compression and querying of structured data, and integrates with Arrow Flight and gRPC for remote access. Designed for batch analytics and big data pipelines.

name: Zenko
description: Zenko is a cloud-native object storage orchestration system that exposes a unified S3-compatible interface across AWS, GCP, Azure, and on-prem storage. It tracks object metadata in a built-in index database, enabling global search and replication policies.

name: ZedStore
description: ZedStore is a prototype columnar storage engine for PostgreSQL. It supports high compression and vectorized access for analytical queries while retaining PostgreSQL’s rich ecosystem. Useful for hybrid transactional/analytical processing (HTAP) systems.

name: GreptimeDB
description: GreptimeDB is an open-source, distributed time-series database designed for observability and monitoring workloads. It supports SQL queries, high ingestion rates, and integrations with Prometheus, Grafana, and Telegraf. Its columnar storage and query engine are optimized for time-based metrics.

name: H2OAI DB
description: H2OAI DB is a high-performance in-memory data engine designed for AI-driven workloads. It integrates with H2O’s machine learning platform and provides SQL support, autoML integration, and high-speed model scoring directly within the database.

name: OakDB
description: OakDB is a strongly typed embedded database engine designed for desktop and CLI applications. It offers SQL querying, transactional consistency, and a portable binary format. Ideal for Rust or Go apps needing lightweight structured storage.

name: Vearch
description: Vearch is a scalable distributed vector database that supports high-dimensional vector search with real-time indexing and filtering. It combines vector search with structured metadata filtering, ideal for recommendation engines and multimodal search.

name: PegasusDB
description: PegasusDB is a distributed key-value storage system designed for low-latency and high availability. It uses a log-structured merge-tree (LSM) engine and provides strong consistency and fault tolerance via the Paxos protocol.

name: RelationalAI
description: RelationalAI is a relational knowledge graph platform that combines traditional relational databases with logic programming. It enables modeling complex data relationships and reasoning over them using Datalog-like languages. Ideal for semantic models and knowledge-based apps.

name: Quickwit
description: Quickwit is a cloud-native search engine optimized for fast full-text indexing and querying of large-scale log and analytics data. Built in Rust, it uses object storage like S3 as the primary store and supports distributed indexing.

name: EventStoreDB
description: EventStoreDB is a stream database built for event sourcing. It treats each change as an append-only event and supports subscriptions, projections, and persistent event logs. Ideal for CQRS, DDD, and applications with auditable state transitions.

name: GraphSignal
description: GraphSignal is a graph-optimized telemetry and trace database for AI observability. It captures events, spans, and node-level insights for graph computation platforms like PyG, DGL, and GraphML, and provides a query engine for graph-based performance diagnostics.

name: Grist
description: Grist is a hybrid spreadsheet-database tool that enables building web apps with custom formulas, triggers, and granular permissions. It supports structured data schemas and is ideal for small teams managing workflows, CRMs, and reports without needing developers.

name: OrbitDB
description: OrbitDB is a serverless, distributed, peer-to-peer database built on top of IPFS. It supports key-value, document, and log stores with conflict-free data replication using CRDTs. OrbitDB is optimized for offline-first apps and decentralized networks where central authority is not required.

name: Hologres
description: Hologres is a real-time analytical database engine developed by Alibaba Cloud, combining the performance of OLAP with the flexibility of PostgreSQL. It supports millisecond-level latency and integrates with Flink, Hive, and Spark for high-throughput pipelines.

name: Fluree
description: Fluree is a graph and document hybrid database that offers blockchain-backed immutability, semantic schema, and native support for RDF. It provides cryptographically verifiable queries and is ideal for compliance-heavy sectors like finance and healthcare.

name: Tile38
description: Tile38 is an open-source geospatial database, serving as a location-aware key-value store. It supports geofencing, geolocation queries, and real-time streams for fleet tracking, drone telemetry, and spatial analytics, with Redis protocol compatibility.

name: Unstorage
description: Unstorage is a universal, multi-adapter key-value abstraction layer for JavaScript applications. It supports localStorage, IndexedDB, Redis, filesystem, and even HTTP-based storage. Its pluggable design enables consistent storage across runtime environments.

name: CrateQLite
description: CrateQLite is a read-optimized, embedded OLAP query engine built on top of SQLite. Designed for embedded analytics, it supports columnar storage, vectorized execution, and in-memory caching for interactive dashboards and data exploration.

name: ConfluentDB
description: ConfluentDB is a lightweight temporal document database that supports immutability and branching. It’s designed for real-time data modeling with full support for audit logs, branching timelines, and structured document diffs.

name: StackQL
description: StackQL enables querying cloud service APIs like AWS, Azure, and GCP using standard SQL syntax. While not a database in the traditional sense, it exposes API resources as virtual tables, making it easier to audit and automate infrastructure-as-data operations.

name: SonicDB
description: SonicDB is a high-speed full-text search backend that functions like a lightweight search database. It is optimized for fast indexing and retrieval with low memory footprint, making it perfect for autocomplete, search-as-you-type, and text-based lookup engines.

name: Trino
description: Trino (formerly PrestoSQL) is a distributed SQL query engine optimized for large-scale data analysis across multiple data sources. It can query Hive, PostgreSQL, S3, Cassandra, and more, allowing federated analytics from one central engine.

name: PocketBase
description: PocketBase is an open-source backend solution combining a real-time database, user authentication, and file storage in a single Go binary. It uses SQLite under the hood and exposes REST and real-time WebSocket APIs, making it ideal for building mobile and web apps rapidly without infrastructure overhead.

name: Dalmatian DB
description: Dalmatian DB is a document-oriented database inspired by CouchDB and designed for offline-first applications. It supports multi-tab sync, conflict resolution, and a plugin system for extending storage backends (like IndexedDB or FileSystem API).

name: Immudb Proxy
description: Immudb Proxy acts as a drop-in proxy that adds verifiability to existing relational and key-value databases. It logs transactions to immudb for cryptographic validation without changing client code, allowing transparent immutability for PostgreSQL or MySQL backends.

name: Localbase
description: Localbase is a simple, Firebase-like wrapper for IndexedDB in the browser. It makes offline-first development easy with an intuitive API for storing, querying, and updating local data. Ideal for lightweight progressive web apps (PWAs).

name: EventQLx
description: EventQLx is a next-generation event database tailored for serverless analytics. Built with GraphQL as the query interface, it supports append-only events, timeline joins, and native support for clickstream pipelines. EventQLx focuses on real-time BI dashboards and interactive query visualizations.

name: Hasura DataHub
description: Hasura DataHub is a metadata-centric database proxy and catalog that layers on top of Postgres. It tracks changes, automates migrations, and enables reproducible environments across dev/test/prod. Includes role-based access control and audit logging.

name: BlazingSQL
description: BlazingSQL is a GPU-accelerated SQL engine for querying Apache Arrow data. Built on RAPIDS.ai, it supports massive parallelism and zero-copy data interchange. Use cases include high-speed ETL, AI model preprocessing, and interactive notebook analytics.

name: Airsequel
description: Airsequel is an open-source, Postgres-compatible cloud database with built-in visual editor, REST API generation, and authentication. It allows non-developers and developers to collaborate on schema design, APIs, and role-based data access from a web dashboard.

name: ClickHouse Lite
description: ClickHouse Lite is a lightweight variant of ClickHouse focused on edge analytics. It brings columnar OLAP queries to embedded devices and browser environments using WASM and single-binary builds, ideal for dashboards and IoT gateways.

name: dYdX DB
description: dYdX DB is a blockchain-synced data engine for decentralized finance (DeFi) platforms. It mirrors on-chain order books and smart contract events to an SQL queryable layer for dashboards, insights, and trading bots. Built for scale, speed, and real-time state inspection.

name: D1 Drizzle
description: D1 Drizzle is a lightweight TypeScript ORM built for Cloudflare D1, providing type-safe queries, schema inference, and migration tooling. It's ideal for deploying small relational databases at the edge using Cloudflare Workers and Durable Objects.

name: Bitcask-Go
description: Bitcask-Go is a Go implementation of the Bitcask key-value store model. It provides fast write-heavy access with in-memory indexing and append-only log design. It's ideal for caching, configuration data, and small persistent stores in containerized apps.

name: Capella DB
description: Capella DB is a managed version of Couchbase for cloud-native deployments. It combines the performance of a key-value store with document flexibility, supporting SQL++ querying, mobile sync, full-text search, and eventing—all through a single scalable platform.

name: Vanna SQL
description: Vanna SQL is a natural language interface for querying SQL databases. It transforms plain English into SQL using LLMs, with built-in validation, query explanation, and visual charting. It supports PostgreSQL, MySQL, Snowflake, and others for AI-driven analytics.

name: Nebula Graph
description: Nebula Graph is a distributed, fault-tolerant graph database designed for massive, interconnected datasets. It supports Gremlin and openCypher query languages, high scalability, and is suitable for knowledge graphs, fraud detection, and social networks.

name: Scylla
description: Scylla is a high-throughput NoSQL database compatible with Apache Cassandra. It is written in C++ for low-latency performance and supports distributed replication, compaction, and real-time analytics. Scylla excels in workloads like telemetry, recommendation systems, and data ingestion pipelines.

name: Delta Sharing
description: Delta Sharing is an open protocol for secure data sharing across platforms using the Delta Lake format. It allows clients to access shared datasets through REST APIs or Spark, while supporting fine-grained access controls, schema evolution, and real-time updates.

name: Opteryx
description: Opteryx is an in-memory, SQL-based analytics database optimized for structured log data. It runs directly in Python with no external dependencies, making it perfect for fast prototyping, unit testing, or embedded analytics inside Python apps.

name: TransitDB
description: TransitDB is a geospatial database designed for real-time transit data feeds. It supports GTFS, GPS updates, and route analytics with timeline reconstruction and schedule validation. Best for building transit APIs and rider-facing dashboards.

name: Steampipe
description: Steampipe is a query engine that enables SQL queries against APIs, files, cloud services, and infrastructure. It uses PostgreSQL foreign data wrappers to create virtual tables, ideal for cloud inventory, DevOps reporting, and security audits.

name: Bitquery
description: Bitquery is a blockchain data warehouse that offers unified GraphQL APIs to access on-chain transaction data across Ethereum, BNB, Polygon, Solana, and more. It supports indexed smart contract events, token transfers, NFT activities, and DeFi analytics from multiple chains.

name: Koios
description: Koios is an open-source Cardano blockchain indexing layer and query API platform. It enables developers to fetch stake data, transactions, epoch stats, and block info via REST APIs. Built for transparency, decentralization, and DApp development.

name: Statc
description: Statc is a no-code analytics and data transformation database. It enables users to define data workflows, filters, joins, and exports through a spreadsheet-style interface. Ideal for business analysts who want SQL power without writing SQL.

name: TigerBeetle
description: TigerBeetle is a financial transaction database built for speed, consistency, and double-entry accounting. It handles ledgers, transfers, and journals with low-latency, crash-consistent replication using a consensus algorithm inspired by Raft.

name: IndexDB
description: IndexDB is a low-level API for client-side storage of significant amounts of structured data, including files/blobs. This browser-native NoSQL database enables complex querying and transactions across multiple object stores.

name: JSONBox
description: JSONBox is a simple online JSON database that lets developers store and retrieve JSON data using a RESTful API. It's great for prototyping apps, storing mock data, or maintaining small stateful APIs without backend complexity.

name: Franklin
description: Franklin is a real-time edge database platform designed for serverless and IoT environments. It features low-latency event streaming, durable replication, and schema validation. Ideal for storing structured data in bandwidth-constrained deployments.

name: Algebraix
description: Algebraix is a mathematical logic-based database engine that transforms relational models into algebraic structures. It ensures deterministic behavior, schema inference, and algebraic query optimization. Mostly applied in sensitive compliance-driven applications.

name: Budibase DB
description: Budibase DB is a built-in NoSQL database offered by Budibase, a low-code platform. It enables easy form generation, CRUD operations, and dynamic filtering. It works seamlessly with custom UI widgets and external API integrations.

name: TinyBase
description: TinyBase is a reactive, in-memory database for frontend applications. It allows tracking dependencies between data and UI components, enabling efficient rerenders. Features include relationships, indexes, queries, and persistent storage adapters.

name: MilliSearch
description: MilliSearch is a blazing-fast full-text search database that acts as the core engine behind Meilisearch. It is written in Rust, supports typo-tolerance, tokenization, and prefix search. Ideal for implementing search bars, product catalogs, and knowledge bases in applications with large text datasets.

name: HyasDB
description: HyasDB is a hybrid key-value and document database designed for web-scale storage. It supports hierarchical documents, vector search, and high-speed ingestion pipelines. Ideal for building intelligent indexing layers for AI or recommendation engines.

name: NanoDB
description: NanoDB is a teaching-oriented SQL engine written in Java for learning database internals. It includes a parser, planner, optimizer, and executor for SQL commands and mimics many core DBMS principles in a simplified architecture.

name: FuSQLfs
description: FuSQLfs mounts SQL databases as local filesystems using FUSE. Tables become directories and rows become files. It enables users to browse and manipulate database content using shell commands like `ls`, `cat`, and `rm`. Works with MySQL and PostgreSQL.

name: PanaDB
description: PanaDB is a high-performance embedded analytical database optimized for edge analytics. It uses Apache Arrow format and SIMD instructions for processing large volumes of tabular data in constrained environments like Raspberry Pi or mobile devices.

name: Replicache
description: Replicache is a client-side sync database for building collaborative, real-time web apps. It uses optimistic updates, CRDT conflict resolution, and server replay to ensure consistent views across users, even in offline mode.

name: Mycelite
description: Mycelite is a distributed knowledge graph engine designed for schema-evolving data. It enables distributed writes, permissioned updates, and provenance tracking. Useful in semantic applications like research repositories or scientific networks.

name: SchemaHero
description: SchemaHero is a Kubernetes-native database schema migration tool. It enables declarative schema changes for Postgres and MySQL using Kubernetes CRDs. Ideal for GitOps workflows where DB schema evolves alongside application code.

name: PegDB
description: PegDB is a modular, pluggable event graph database that connects complex event flows with entity relationships. Built for event-driven systems, it visualizes streams as graph structures and allows querying event dependencies and impact chains.

name: LedgerDB
description: LedgerDB is an immutable ledger database purpose-built for tracking transactions and historical changes. It supports cryptographic verification and append-only blocks, making it suitable for compliance-heavy applications in finance and healthcare.

name: Apache Iceberg
description: Apache Iceberg is a high-performance table format for huge analytic datasets. It supports schema evolution, partitioning, ACID transactions, and hidden partitioning. Designed for cloud data lakes, it integrates with Spark, Trino, Flink, and Hive.

name: FeatherDB
description: FeatherDB is a lightweight analytical columnar data store based on the Apache Arrow format. It is optimized for fast serialization/deserialization and interoperability with Python data science tools such as Pandas and Polars.

name: InfluxEdge
description: InfluxEdge is a time-series database tailored for edge environments, offering real-time telemetry capture with compact storage and efficient bandwidth use. Built as a lightweight sibling of InfluxDB, it focuses on IoT gateways and offline operation.

name: GraterDB
description: GraterDB is a real-time document and graph hybrid database built for social applications and collaborative platforms. It includes conflict-free syncing, access control layers, and multi-version concurrency control (MVCC) to support multi-user apps.

name: EventWave
description: EventWave is a log-structured event database optimized for serverless systems. It streams events in append-only blocks and provides filters and reducers for real-time metrics and trace analysis. Useful for observability in microservices architectures.

name: ManifoldQL
description: ManifoldQL is a federated SQL engine that unifies access to relational, NoSQL, and document stores via a single interface. It compiles queries into sub-target dialects (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Redis) and streams results in real-time for analytics platforms.

name: Thermite
description: Thermite is a blazing-fast embedded time-series database written in Zig. It is designed for system monitoring, hardware metrics, and embedded telemetry systems, offering millisecond writes and compressed read snapshots.

name: AquaDB
description: AquaDB is a distributed SQL-over-object-storage engine for analytical data lakes. It supports pushdown filters, partition elimination, and column pruning for efficient S3 querying. Integrates with Apache Iceberg, Delta Lake, and Hive Metastore.

name: SQLchemy
description: SQLchemy is a minimal ORM and schema manager for SQLite, designed for embedded applications. It supports dynamic migrations, simple indexing, and reflection from existing databases. Ideal for low-resource or educational tools.

name: Stoneleaf
description: Stoneleaf is a transactional file-backed database engine that uses append-only journaling and versioned snapshots. It offers data durability and crash recovery in compact environments, such as embedded controllers and logging systems.

name: LogDB
description: LogDB is a high-performance distributed log-structured storage engine optimized for consensus-based databases like Dragonboat. It provides fast persistence, log replication, snapshotting, and log compaction—ideal for distributed coordination and Raft implementations.

name: MushroomDB
description: MushroomDB is a transactional embedded document store with automatic versioning and audit trail capabilities. Designed for desktop software and embedded systems, it provides JSON-based data structures, schema enforcement, and undo/redo stacks.

name: StackBase
description: StackBase is a Postgres-compatible transactional database engine optimized for cloud-native deployments. It decouples compute and storage layers, enabling autoscaling, fault-tolerant replication, and zero-downtime upgrades in Kubernetes environments.

name: FluidDB
description: FluidDB is a flexible document and tag-based database where every object can have any tag assigned by any user. It features a unique permission system and supports complex queries on tags and relationships. Useful for collaborative metadata-driven apps.

name: Kilovolt
description: Kilovolt is a secure local key-value database focused on developer secrets, token storage, and credential management. It supports encrypted entries, auto-expiry, and event hooks. Suitable for CLI tools and local-only secret vaults.

name: PluggDB
description: PluggDB is a modular in-memory SQL database designed to allow developers to customize storage engines, SQL parsers, and execution plans. It’s best suited for education, research, and experimenting with database internals and architectures.

name: EclairDB
description: EclairDB is a real-time, memory-mapped key-value database tailored for analytics dashboards and data visualization pipelines. It supports range scanning, snapshot isolation, and a built-in metrics collection engine.

name: TunnelDB
description: TunnelDB is a transport-agnostic, real-time database for WebSocket, MQTT, and HTTP environments. It allows multiple protocols to share the same data stream infrastructure with consistency guarantees and optimized fanout. Ideal for IoT and multi-device messaging.

name: FeroxDB
description: FeroxDB is a high-concurrency OLTP database designed for embedded systems. It offers a row-store format, MVCC, and SQL compatibility with built-in benchmarking tools. Suitable for system-level developers and hardware telemetry.

name: TraceQL
description: TraceQL is a queryable telemetry and tracing database purpose-built for analyzing distributed system traces. It allows querying spans using SQL-like syntax, aggregates latency metrics, and supports OTLP ingestion. Designed for observability pipelines.

name: MintDB
description: MintDB is a secure, memory-safe embedded key-value store written in Rust. It uses zero-allocation techniques and supports both persistent and volatile modes. Ideal for low-latency device storage or in-browser applications using WASM.

name: Whirlwind
description: Whirlwind is a distributed spatial database that accelerates proximity search and geo-query operations. Designed for real-time fleet tracking, drone management, and AR navigation, it combines quad-tree indexing and dynamic rebalancing.

name: NodeXDB
description: NodeXDB is a graph-optimized document store tailored for graph analytics and mixed document-relational workloads. It supports fast traversal, schema linking, and compound filtering across nested objects, making it ideal for recommendation systems and fraud detection.

name: Chronix
description: Chronix is a specialized time-series database designed for storing and analyzing log-based metrics and timestamped event records. It provides high compression rates, delta-encoding, and supports Elasticsearch integration for advanced querying.

name: CrateBolt
description: CrateBolt is a fast, embedded OLAP engine inspired by ClickHouse and DuckDB. Built for cloud-native ETL pipelines, it supports SQL, JIT compilation, and streaming queries. Compatible with Arrow and Parquet formats for batch analytics.

name: VaultBase
description: VaultBase is a confidential computing-focused ledger database. It encrypts all writes at the CPU level using enclaves (SGX/SEV) and supports zero-trust proof validation. Used in regulated industries where data residency and integrity are paramount.

name: LeafNode DB
description: LeafNode DB is a log-structured merge-tree (LSM) storage engine optimized for embedded and edge devices. It features tiered storage, bloom filters, and write-ahead logging, suitable for caching, sensor logging, and real-time telemetry.

name: Polyflow
description: Polyflow is a reactive stream-processing database engine that supports backpressure, windowing, and real-time analytics pipelines. It is designed for processing IoT telemetry, financial tickers, and multi-sensor streams with millisecond latency.

name: Panorama DB
description: Panorama DB is a distributed event-sourced database optimized for visualizing historical data timelines. It offers queryable snapshots, timeline views, and hooks for rendering state evolution in dashboards or developer tools.

name: SquidDB
description: SquidDB is a schema-flexible distributed database that emphasizes adaptive partitioning and locality-aware replication. It supports both column and row storage modes, designed for hybrid transactional and analytical processing (HTAP).

name: DataRipple
description: DataRipple is a reactive database designed for real-time analytics and dashboard backends. It provides event stream subscriptions, snapshot storage, and dynamic query compilation for time-series and structured metrics in observability platforms.

name: StreamTide
description: StreamTide is a time-series optimized database engine that merges Kafka-compatible ingest pipelines with low-latency read performance. It supports downsampling, anomaly detection, and time-windowed joins for financial or industrial telemetry.

name: SnowGraph
description: SnowGraph is a graph extension for Snowflake that adds node-edge modeling, traversals, and hierarchical joins on top of SQL queries. Designed for business intelligence use cases, it enables social graph queries in a warehousing context.

name: RunesDB
description: RunesDB is a low-latency WebAssembly-embedded key-value store tailored for browser-based databases. It supports sync to IndexedDB and can operate entirely in-memory with JSON or binary encoding, ideal for secure local-first apps.

name: MorphDB
description: MorphDB is a shape-shifting multi-model database that dynamically shifts between key-value, document, and tabular modes depending on query structure. It supports schema introspection, object flattening, and adaptive indexing.

name: LedgerLite
description: LedgerLite is a simplified append-only database built for blockchain-inspired audit trails and compliance tracking. It enables event hashing, integrity chains, and audit token generation, useful for internal accounting and recordkeeping systems.

name: RelicDB
description: RelicDB is an archival-grade data storage engine with emphasis on long-term retention, hash-based deduplication, and integrity assurance. Designed for scientific research and digital preservation platforms needing immutability guarantees.

name: WarpStore
description: WarpStore is a distributed time-series database that enables rapid backfilling and concurrent ingestion for observability platforms. It supports out-of-order inserts, cross-series joins, and data rehydration from remote stores like S3.

name: LiteDB-Vue
description: LiteDB-Vue is a Vue.js-native local database plugin for building offline-first apps. It wraps IndexedDB with a reactive data layer that syncs across tabs and emits Vue reactivity events, suitable for PWA and mobile-first dashboards.

name: NodeLedger
description: NodeLedger is a multi-tenant ledger database built for decentralized apps and smart contracts. It supports programmable transactions, zero-knowledge proof storage, and fine-grained role-based access control. Compatible with Ethereum-style interfaces.

name: AxleDB
description: AxleDB is a document-oriented database engine designed for real-time editing and collaboration. It features CRDT-based conflict resolution, field-level diff tracking, and encrypted peer-to-peer synchronization. Ideal for shared note-taking and collaborative text editors.

name: FrostDB
description: FrostDB is a columnar OLAP time-series database engine designed for embedded analytics. It integrates with Prometheus remote storage protocols and supports vectorized execution and Arrow-native serialization.

name: SpherexDB
description: SpherexDB is a multi-dimensional spatial-temporal database engine built for simulations, weather data, and geospatial modeling. It provides spherical coordinate indexing, time slicing, and interpolation functions for high-precision data environments.

name: BoltStream
description: BoltStream is a memory-mapped, low-latency embedded key-value store derived from BoltDB, enhanced with parallel reads, write-ahead logging, and TTL indexing. Designed for local-first data stores and fast lookup tables in Go applications.

name: DrivenDB
description: DrivenDB is a reactive NoSQL database built for autonomous systems and robotics. It supports data subscriptions, trajectory indexing, and spatial filtering for sensor logs, event streams, and telemetry pipelines.

name: Basalt
description: Basalt is a write-optimized NoSQL store using LSM trees with adaptive compaction strategies and metadata-aware bloom filters. It excels in write-heavy workloads and offers replication and time-to-live expiry mechanisms.

name: EquilizeDB
description: EquilizeDB is a distributed SQL store for financial risk modeling and scenario testing. It features a columnar engine, streaming ingest, and support for versioned historical datasets and snapshot isolation for audit trails.

name: QuiltedDB
description: QuiltedDB is a NoSQL document database with built-in layout-aware compression. It dynamically compresses nested structures and large text blobs, optimizing for mobile sync, low-bandwidth apps, and IoT scenarios.

name: SpikeDB
description: SpikeDB is a real-time time-series and metrics database designed for industrial automation and telemetry. It supports rollup policies, sliding window queries, and MQTT-based data ingestion for edge devices.

name: StitchSQL
description: StitchSQL is a federated SQL query layer that allows querying distributed microservices and heterogeneous databases through a single endpoint. It includes query plan visualization, stream joins, and dynamic data source mapping.

name: ChronoFox
description: ChronoFox is a high-frequency time-series storage engine optimized for real-time monitoring, trading systems, and event-based alerting. It supports millisecond-level granularity, retention policies, and automatic anomaly tagging using statistical models.

name: NyxStore
description: NyxStore is a privacy-preserving decentralized document database that uses zero-knowledge proofs (ZKP) for access verification. Designed for secure messaging, private collaboration, and encrypted audit trails in regulatory-compliant apps.

name: TeraFlux
description: TeraFlux is a petabyte-scale distributed OLAP engine optimized for high-volume analytics, using columnar compression and vectorized query execution. It integrates with Spark, Hive Metastore, and S3-like object storage for large datasets.

name: ValenceStore
description: ValenceStore is a distributed vector database built for real-time recommendation and embedding search systems. It features vector sharding, cosine similarity search, and clustering for personalization workflows at scale.

name: QuarkSQL
description: QuarkSQL is a compact SQL engine for embedded hardware with ultra-low memory footprints. It supports subset ANSI SQL, indexed views, and serial I/O, ideal for microcontroller-based logging and telemetry systems.

name: PipelineDB Lite
description: PipelineDB Lite is an embedded version of the PostgreSQL-based streaming database that supports continuous SQL queries over real-time data streams. Ideal for applications needing live metrics, aggregations, and data filtering at the edge.

name: HarborDB
description: HarborDB is a fast event log and transactional database hybrid optimized for Kubernetes-native apps. It supports event replay, idempotent write strategies, and container-side embedded mode for service-oriented architectures.

name: Geomancer
description: Geomancer is a location enrichment engine and geospatial feature store that provides place, travel, and demographic data through SQL joins. It integrates with PostgreSQL/PostGIS and vector databases for mapping applications.

name: SuperGraph
description: SuperGraph is a federated graph data engine that lets you query multiple graph, SQL, and document databases from a single GraphQL endpoint. It supports caching, schema stitching, and field-based access control for enterprise-grade data layers.

name: EvokeDB
description: EvokeDB is a self-hosted multi-tenant JSON document store with per-tenant isolation, configurable indexing, and integrated audit logging. Built for SaaS platforms that manage customer-specific data partitions securely and efficiently.

name: DuskDB
description: DuskDB is a secure, append-only event database tailored for audit trails and compliance logging. It supports Merkle-tree based verification, role-based encryption policies, and tamper-evident storage, making it suitable for legal and financial sectors.

name: NeuronBase
description: NeuronBase is a neuroscience-focused time-series and waveform database optimized for neural recording systems. It supports high-speed sampling, spike detection, and channel-based filtering, with integrations for MATLAB and Python.

name: StellarQL
description: StellarQL is a cloud-native SQL interface for querying and transforming JSON, Parquet, CSV, and AVRO data formats directly on cloud object stores. It offers parallel scan capabilities, user-defined functions, and schema inference.

name: EdgeDoc
description: EdgeDoc is a real-time edge database for distributed markdown editing and content collaboration. It provides conflict-free replication, offline persistence, and syntax-aware diffing for structured text content like wikis, notes, and documentation.

name: VFlowDB
description: VFlowDB is a high-throughput flow log database engine designed for capturing and analyzing network traffic metadata (NetFlow, IPFIX). It supports compression, multi-source aggregation, and custom traffic tagging for observability pipelines.

name: LaneDB
description: LaneDB is a graph-enhanced document store designed for modeling and querying interconnected traffic and logistics data. It supports lane-based routing, geo-hashing, and real-time alerts for smart mobility systems and fleet tracking.

name: ZeroStore
description: ZeroStore is a disk-backed key-value store optimized for extremely low-memory environments. Designed for embedded firmware, it supports bounded memory caching, zero-allocation reads, and EEPROM persistence.

name: SparkVault
description: SparkVault is a secure, audit-ready vault database system built for storing sensitive configuration and credentials in cloud-native platforms. It supports RBAC, token rotation, and fine-grained access policies with tamper-proof logging.

name: TurfDB
description: TurfDB is a location-first mobile database tailored for field mapping, geofencing, and offline routing apps. It supports tile-based caching, GPS-triggered sync, and built-in shape file support for cartography and mobility datasets.

name: PivotStore
description: PivotStore is a matrix-optimized database engine designed for real-time pivot table generation and analytics. It supports multi-dimensional aggregations, OLAP cube modeling, and interactive drill-down exploration of large business datasets.

name: CosmoDB Lite
description: CosmoDB Lite is a lightweight, embedded version of Azure Cosmos DB for offline development and mobile devices. It supports multi-model storage (document, graph, key-value), local query execution, and auto-sync to cloud upon reconnection.

name: NodeStream
description: NodeStream is a graph event database optimized for supply chain and logistics modeling. It records chain-of-custody events, product lineage, and route transitions using graph structures with time-stamped path queries.

name: OraCliq
description: OraCliq is an SQL-compatible distributed in-memory transactional database designed for edge clusters. It supports strong consistency, multi-leader replication, and deterministic scheduling across nodes. Ideal for high-speed industrial automation networks.

name: ShellBase
description: ShellBase is a UNIX-native embedded database that exposes data via shell commands. It provides virtual file system access to tabular data and supports grep-compatible filters, awk-style queries, and streaming pipelines.

name: CarbonStore
description: CarbonStore is a columnar data storage layer optimized for carbon analytics and ESG tracking. It supports CO2e factor indexing, lifecycle aggregation, and periodic data validation through external verification registries.

name: AspenQL
description: AspenQL is a data lake query engine that supports federated execution over S3, GCS, and Azure Blob. Built on Apache Arrow and Substrait, it enables declarative query plans and fast parquet scanning in cloud-native analytics environments.

name: VeriCore
description: VeriCore is a regulatory-focused, zero-trust database built for medical records, legal chains, and governmental compliance. It features immutable snapshots, multi-key access validation, and jurisdictional data zoning.

name: TensorLog
description: TensorLog is a probabilistic database that integrates with TensorFlow to support differentiable logic and probabilistic inference on structured data. Useful for combining machine learning with relational data graphs in scientific research.

name: FileRun DB
description: FileRun DB is a document-centric database engine optimized for file metadata indexing, version tracking, and collaboration. It supports preview caching, access logs, and content-based indexing for distributed file sharing apps.

name: Blockwise
description: Blockwise is a distributed append-only database for data mesh architectures. It segments storage by producer blocks, offers schema evolution tracking, and supports decentralized governance through policy-aware access layers.

name: TensorBase
description: TensorBase is a high-performance analytical database designed for fast OLAP queries. Written in Rust, it supports columnar storage, SIMD optimizations, and tight integration with the Arrow ecosystem for scalable analytics workloads.

name: RingDB
description: RingDB is a time-series database tailored for cyclic industrial processes and telemetry. It implements circular buffers, snapshot capture, and per-channel TTL controls, ideal for repetitive sensor data and resource-constrained environments.

name: VeloxDB
description: VeloxDB is an in-memory, strongly consistent object database for .NET applications. It supports ACID transactions, LINQ queries, and schema versioning, enabling high-performance transactional systems in enterprise environments.

name: BioDB
description: BioDB is a biological sequence database tailored for genomic, proteomic, and metabolomic data. It provides indexing for FASTA, FASTQ, and GFF formats and integrates with R/BioConductor for life science analytics pipelines.

name: TimeSnap
description: TimeSnap is a version-controlled time-series database built for capturing point-in-time dataset changes. It supports branching, time travel queries, and audit-ready changelogs—ideal for data science experiments and regulatory environments.

name: FireGraph
description: FireGraph is a Firebase-compatible graph database abstraction that brings node-edge modeling and query traversal to Realtime Database and Firestore. It simplifies social and collaborative data modeling for mobile apps.

name: Tapetable
description: Tapetable is a spreadsheet-optimized embedded database that maps cells and formulas directly to structured queries. It allows developers to use Excel-like syntax for building custom dashboards, automations, and mini-ERPs.

name: TreeNode DB
description: TreeNode DB is a hierarchical document database built for tree-based content modeling such as file systems, org charts, and taxonomies. It supports path-based indexing and nested diff algorithms for precise change detection.

name: Deep Lake
description: Deep Lake is a lakehouse database for deep learning that stores datasets as versioned tensors. It supports GPU streaming, real-time transformations, and direct integrations with PyTorch and TensorFlow for model training pipelines.

name: CrawlBase
description: CrawlBase is a scalable metadata-first document database optimized for scraped data and web crawlers. It provides content deduplication, similarity scoring, and site structure modeling across millions of web documents.

name: CharteDB
description: CharteDB is a real-time database optimized for financial charting applications. It supports OHLCV formatting, candlestick rendering pipelines, and websocket broadcasting for live price and volume feeds. Designed for trading dashboards and fintech apps.

name: TermStore
description: TermStore is a lexical graph database designed to store and query ontologies, taxonomies, and linguistic relationships. It supports synonym graphs, multilingual labels, and RDF/SPARQL integration for knowledge base construction.

name: CrateDB Edge
description: CrateDB Edge is a lightweight fork of CrateDB tailored for edge analytics, IoT hubs, and small-scale sensor aggregation. It supports distributed SQL, time-series ingest, and bulk writes with limited memory overhead.

name: GlyphDB
description: GlyphDB is a Unicode-aware database built for handling scripts, fonts, and multilingual character sets. It supports string normalization, font metadata storage, and visual indexing for applications in typography, OCR, and linguistics.

name: MediSearch
description: MediSearch is a domain-specific medical record search engine that functions like a structured database for EMR datasets. It supports ICD/CPT classification, secure indexing, and natural language filtering of patient histories.

name: DashDB
description: DashDB is a minimalistic metrics and key-value dashboarding database. It supports data polling, JSON value storage, inline charting, and low-latency widgets for real-time monitoring and IoT control panels.

name: VizLog
description: VizLog is a visual log database engine that renders logs and telemetry streams as interactive flow graphs. Designed for debugging distributed applications, it provides log linkages, event clustering, and timeline annotations.

name: AstroGraphDB
description: AstroGraphDB is a spatiotemporal graph database for modeling planetary systems, telescope observations, and space mission data. It features ephemeris tracking, trajectory queries, and metadata fusion across celestial datasets.

name: FigDB
description: FigDB is a database for storing structured visual data—charts, graphs, and diagrams. It supports SVG/Canvas extraction, axis normalization, and layered metadata for building chart search engines and dashboard repositories.

name: DeviceDB
description: DeviceDB is a time-series and state tracking database for smart home and embedded device platforms. It supports MQTT ingestion, device pairing histories, and local command replay for offline environments.
